page.title: 02Alrewas Bowls Club
page.content: Alrewas Bowls club is situated on a small piece of ground between the Church and the canal. It has a crown green approx 40 x 30 yards which is maintained by the members. The annual rent paid to the church is #10. The club is between 80 - 100 years old. Most of the members are retired. 24 are gentlemen and only 5 are ladies. The club only plays friendly matches to ensure that everyone has a game. All members try to attend on Wednesday afternoons. Games are played every day of the week but, because of a condition of the lease, not during church services. The season lasts from Easter until the weather breaks in the autumn.There is a small wooden club house where tea is brewed and equipment is stored.
